subject: Philosophy
title: The Love of Wisdom
description: A quick, practical guide to The Love of Wisdom.

hook.text: Philosophy means 'love of wisdom' in Greek. It began as a radical act of asking why.

buildup.text: Before philosophers, myths explained everything. Thunder was a god's anger, not weather.

discovery.text: Around 600 BCE, Thales asked: what if nature runs on principles we can figure out?

twist.text: He was wrong about water being the basis of everything. But the method was revolutionary.

climax.text: That shift ‚Äî from myth to reason ‚Äî launched science, democracy, and law.

punchline.text: It all started when someone asked 'but why?'

quiz.question: What does 'philosophy' literally mean in Greek?
